rake.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a gardening tool with a row of metal teeth at the end of a long handle, used for making soil level, gathering up dead leaves etc
rake.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a man who has many sexual relationships, drinks too much alcohol etc
rake.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to move a rake across a surface in order to make the soil level, gather dead leaves etc
rake.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: She raked the soil over to loosen the weeds.
rake.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to search a place very carefully for something
rake.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Iâ€™ve been raking through my drawers looking for those tickets.
rake.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to point something such as a gun, camera, or strong light, and keep moving it across an area
rake.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: The searchlight raked the open ground around the prison.
They raked the room with gunfire.
rake.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to push a stick backwards and forwards in a fire in order to remove ashes
